text.footnote: documented as of this encounter (statuses as of 10/05/2023)
documented as of this encounter (statuses as of 10/05/2023)

content.content:
Formatting of this note is different from the original.
POST OPERATIVE NOTE
Patient ID: Bob G Bilek is a 52 y.o. male.
Chief Complaint: Follow-up and Post-op of the Right Knee
HPI:
Prior surgery: Right open patellar tendon repair and removal of tibial tubercle ossicle on 09/21/2020.
Currently in a: no brace/sling
Pain is: not present
Currently taking: no medications
Wound problems: no
Current Weight Bearing Status: WBAT
Current Work status: off work
Bob presents today 11 months s/p right knee surgery. He is doing well. He has recovered from his setback at work conditioning. He has been progressing his HEP.
The following portions of the patients history were reviewed and updated as appropriate: allergies, current medication review, family history, social history and surgical history.
PHYSICAL EXAM:
Surgical incisions which are well healed. There is no erythema, no fluctuance, no drainage, no signs of infection.
ROM is full and painless
Quad strength: 5/5
Hamstring strength: 5/5
Distally the patient is neurovascularly intact. Normal pulse exam with 2+ distal pulses. Rapid cap refill.
ASSESSMENT:
Aftercare following surgery of the musculoskeletal system
11 months s/p right knee open patellar tendon repair and removal of tibial tubercle ossicle. DOS 09/21/2021
He had a set back at work conditioning about 4 weeks ago- he felt a pull in the anterior knee while doing lunges which resulted in increased pain. This is why he was unable to return to work last visit. This pain has improved over the last month with activity modification.
POST OP PLAN:
The patient is making expected progress status post surgery.
There are no physical exam signs concerning for infection at this time
We will continue with the post operative rehabilitation protocol as instructed
WBAT
Recommended OTC ibuprofen 600mg twice daily w/ food PRN for pain when returning to work
Genutrain while working x 4 weeks then PRN
RTW full duty no restrictions on Monday
IME completed
He has reached MMI
Patient will return to clinic for another post operative check as instructed - 3 months
Patient was seen and evaluated by physician assistant, Taylor Atkinson PA-C. The physician assistant was acting as sole provider.
VISIT ORDERS:
No orders of the defined types were placed in this encounter.
Electronically signed by Dr. Tomasz T Antkowiak at 08/24/2021 9:34 PM CDT

paragraph.content: Aftercare following surgery of the musculoskeletal system
